title: Doc alias not allowed on associated constants and types in trait implementation block

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
pub trait Trait {
    const VALUE: u32;
}

pub struct Struct;

impl Trait for Struct {
    #[doc(alias = "kValue")]
    const VALUE: u32 = 42;
}
```

Similarly, I tried:

```rust
trait Trait {
    type Value;
}

struct Struct;

impl Trait for Struct {
    #[doc(alias = "ValueType")]
    type Value = u32;
}
```

I expected to see this happen: the code to compile and searching `kValue` or `ValueType` in the docs to produce `Struct::VALUE` or `Struct::Value` respectively.

Instead, this happened: These failed to compile with the following errors:

> error: `#[doc(alias = "...")]` isn't allowed on associated constant in trait implementation block

> error: `#[doc(alias = "...")]` isn't allowed on type alias in implementation block

This is very surprising because:

- `#[doc(alias)]` works on `fn` trait members in impl blocks.
- Doc comments are allowed on associated constants and types in impl blocks.
